hmm... funkar fr mig. Dremot fr jag inte en sndr kck liten plus-flla-ner-ruta som andra har p sina bilder... Jag har antagligen gjort nt fel, frsta gngen, s sjlvklart mste man lra sig den hrda vgen! ;)
Ska sgas att det inte r min bild, en kompis skickade den till mig, och jag kunde inte hitta ursprungsgaren. Tyckte det var fr kul fr att lta bli att lgga upp, bara.

WRITING.TITLE: Sexismen med glimten i gat - Fotbolltransfers.com

WRITING.TEXT: h tack, jag har faktiskt undrat s smtt!

Fast r inte det du sger tv olika saker nu? Hon bryter vl mot upphovsrttslagstiftningen (t.ex. r jag rtt sker p att man inte fr lgga upp tidningsartiklar s som hon gjort och det r helt upp till olika tidningars rutiner och godtycke om de anmler eller inte, men dremot har tidningen rtten p sin sida. Ibland skickar tidningar t.o.m ut fakturor till folk, nr folk gjort dylikt.); men jag tror inte heller att det kommer att g till ngon domstol fr den sakens skull, vilket vl ocks har pedagogiska meriter.

r pirater verkligen s korkade att de tror att det hr r bra marknadsfring?
Tycker att det hr r ganska pedagogiskt, visar p hur okunniga folk i strsta allmnhet r om upphovsrtt, aprop det dr med att vara korkad. Skadar inte att folk blir uppmrksammade p absurditeterna som existerar i den hr sortens lagstiftning.

I never even believe in it, when claimed, it seems so odd. Perhaps it is an american thing, who knows. The biggest problem as far as door holding goes, are those that hold it up way to early, so you feel obliged to semi-run in order not to keep the person waiting.

Well, I guess I don't believe in everything that's being claimed online to start with, which may explain having doubts in the first place. Those two have problems, that's all we know. Who's to blame or whatever is to be considered normal behaviour here, isn't all that clear is all I'm saying. Is it actually normal (or healthy even) to "settle arguments" this way?
edit: Please note that my question is in earnest.

Also, however crazily enraged the woman is, I find it odd that nobody questions that the guy married to her, films in secret and upload it online. To me, that indicates a less than healthy attitude from the guy, to begin with and gives me the kind of pause you're reflecting. Is that so "normal" or "acceptable" or whatnot?
hihihi, kunde inte lta bli http://i.imgur.com/3LnR5of.gif - blir fr vrigt jtteimponerad av sna hr "maskiner" som dyker upp rtt som det r.
Aw, s fint! Tackar!
hahaha, ja, jag sg det efter jag postade, ingen koll.
Hej, den dr bilden har ju jag gjort, med en kompis! :) Galet coolt att se den landa hr ocks. lska internet, liksom.

There are probably loads of reasons for it, but I think you are quite right that this is one of the reasons. I figure it's a kind of social glue or whatnot, and probably really common. Nothing brings a group together more than a common "enemy" so to speak. It most likely has got very little to do with the people being graded on the outside, and loads to do with the kind of points you can score inside of the group, I figure. It's a human trait - a strength and a weakness depending on the situation, I guess. Women does this too, when bonding, sadly it's not uncommon to trash-talk other women. It's one of my experiences in life, that if you're not ready to "hate" whatever or whomever a group requires you to, you're going to be a rather lonely person. No idea how to tackle that.

Though, I'm not at all certain that "the losers of society" are there because of biological reasons. That's probably more due to financial policies - another pipedream of course - but getting rid of poverty most likely would rid the world of most of the existing criminality. That said, it probably wouldn't prevent passion of crime and whatnot, but I guess we're talking about rather big things here that requires at least one bottle of wine, and loads of time. Biology used as an excuse, is equally ignorant, if you ask me.

Yeah, you're right, absolutely. However, it's just... I dunno... a feeling of "does it HAVE to be"? As I can relate to the sense of taking care, being aware and being careful, it's the other side of the coin that chafes me; the sense of bringing up people to be "rapists" or whatnot. Most men aren't, many men even feel disgusted having to be labeled like that. It just seems like the next "evolutionary" step would be to rid of the catch 22 of "predator-prey"-mentality amongst human beings. Obviously it's a pipe dream of sorts, but still. Can't help myself, think about that rather often.
Okey, gottcha. It's not like it's an invalid worry, considering how ardently people tell me it's like this. I'm just questioning if it has to be, is all.
hehe, could be, I live in Sweden...
So... teaching them would be worse, than worrying? A bit of a head-scratcher here, I'm not sure what you mean by your comment?
k - fair enough. I guess teaching the value of contraceptives, rather than teaching a sense of "helplessness" (is that a word?) still stands though. ;)

Well, sure, but that turns the worry into a self-fulfilling prophecy in the long run, teaching this. I realize that nobody's above worrying, it just strikes me as a rather strange basic premise -- often portraid as specificly being a father's worry. (Also, it paints men to come across rather wonky, which I'm not overly comfortable with). Nothing that's going to change, I'm guessing, it's just strange to see this propelled when it probably isn't the healthiest image to keep alive. Just a thought.
I guess this would be a worry for parents of boys as well, in a way, though? Also, seems that teaching the value of contraceptives would take care of that, I guess.

Though I've always wondered why one should "worry" about girls, honestly? Regardless of "how many dicks" there'd be? Sorry to be all serious and all that, but I have genuinly always wondered about that.

Heh, my mom carried the dishes from the kitchen and heaved it on top of my bed, crumbs and all, when I had a friend visiting. She only needed to do that one, the fear of similar embarrasment was a great reminder whenever I was feeling "absent minded".
Unless they're holding the door open too soon, so you have to start running to reciprocate the politeness. Although, not even then have I personally experienced anybody to be angry visibly...
hahaha - that's a great thought. Wouldn't it be kind of cool if make up artist brought in that little detail here and there whenever apocalypses are the theme in movies!

Last summer I allowed [my beard to grow](http://subject7778.se/2012/07/29/skaggprojektet/). Well, I guess beard is an exaggeration, I've got two--what I called--"tazzles" on my chin. It was only a four week holiday, and I'm kind of curious just how long it could get, if I let it be. Of course, my boss isn't too thrilled about a long term project like that, and I admit that it's kind of a relief even, to have that excuse. Because it wasn't all that easy sporting it, to be honest. (I'm currently considering doing it again this summer, but haven't decided.)
The biggest problem was that people were too polite to mention it. Some you could tell noticed it (you know, looked all over and around my face, just not THERE). I was prepared for snide remarks--anger even--but had no strategy for polite silence. Taught me to speak up to people I meet, and notice something about them. It's a relief to remove the elephant from the room, so to speak.
It was a really interesting experience, all in all, and if possible you should give it a go at some point in your life.
I doubt it's aimed at Putin, though. A rather clever way of informing the general public on what's going on, I think.
You could problably find rentals in the 'burbs, the further out the easier it gets, basically. Within "pendeltg" distance, there should be several options.
Using mere words can't really be regarded as an excuse for "violence", as I see it.
Kul means fun in Swedish, btw.
I felt the same way and it's sad that you've recieved so many downvotes - but I guess that's why it is a bit uncomfortable to watch. A kind of case-in-point-kind of a thing.
Ah, so it's not *her* that is making a fuss, it's other people in your feed? I really appreciate Tweetdeck in cases like that, easy to filter out when needed, perhaps something you can look into.

I can't see that she's made a big thing about it though? At least not on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Elise_Andrew), haven't noticed anything of the sorts, except for linking to the article posted above? What am I missing?
ah, I'm not surprised, Reddit has a sub section for everything!
